00016 bool canCastBetween(MavenCompiler* c, string type1, string type2, bool strict, bool warn) {
00017         if(strict)
00018                 return type1 == type2;
00019         
00020         // matching exact types is always OK
00021         if(type1 == type2)
00022                 return true;
00023         
00024         // this function can take signatures (rather than just bare types)
00025         StringList types1 = split(',', type1);
00026         StringList types2 = split(',', type2);
00027         
00028         // if the number of arguments doesn't match then we know straight away it won't work
00029         if(types1.length() != types2.length())
00030                 return false;
00031         
00032         if(types1.length() > 1) {
00033                 for(int i = 0; i < types1.length(); ++i)
00034                         if(!canCastBetween(c, types1[i], types2[i], strict, warn))
00035                                 return false;
00036                 return true;
00037         }
00038         
00039         // bug #21: this should be smarter, for now we'll assume anything can be an Object
00040         if(type1 == "maven.Object" && !isDataType(type2))
00041                 return true;
00042         
00043         // nil can be assigned to any Object
00044         if(!isDataType(type1) && type2 == "nil")
00045                 return true;
00046         
00047         // if type1 is an enum, the typing is very strict. type2 must be exactly the same
00048         int enumID = findEnumID(c, findNamespaceID(c, c->currentNamespace), type1);
00049         if(enumID >= 0) {
00050                 // an enum may be cast into an integer based type
00051                 if(type2 == "int" || type2 == "long" || type2 == "float" ||
00052                    type2 == "double" || type2 == "quad" || type2 == "char" ||
00053                    type2 == "short")
00054                         return true;
00055                 
00056                 // otherwise no
00057                 return false;
00058         } else if(type1 == "boolean") {
00059                 // definite
00060                 return true;
00061         } else if(type1 == "byte") {
00062                 // definite
00063                 return true;
00064         } else if(type1 == "char") {
00065                 // definite
00066                 if(type2 == "boolean" || type2 == "char" || type2 == "double" ||
00067                    type2 == "float" || type2 == "int" || type2 == "long" ||
00068                    type2 == "quad" || type2 == "short")
00069                         return true;
00070                 
00071                 // may lose precision, but still works
00072                 if(type2 == "byte") {
00073                         if(warn)
00074                                 pushWarning(c, "Possible loss in precision casting '%s' to '%s'", type1, type2);
00075                         return true;
00076                 }
00077                 
00078                 // can't do it
00079                 return false;
00080         } else if(type1 == "double") {
00081                 // definite
00082                 if(type2 == "boolean" || type2 == "quad")
00083                         return true;
00084                 
00085                 // may lose precision, but still works
00086                 if(type2 == "byte" || type2 == "char" || type2 == "float" || type2 == "int" ||
00087                    type2 == "long" || type2 == "short") {
00088                         if(warn)
00089                                 pushWarning(c, "Possible loss in precision casting '%s' to '%s'", type1, type2);
00090                         return true;
00091                 }
00092                 
00093                 // can't do it
00094                 return false;
00095         } else if(type1 == "float") {
00096                 // definite
00097                 if(type2 == "boolean" || type2 == "double" || type2 == "quad")
00098                         return true;
00099                 
00100                 // may lose precision, but still works
00101                 if(type2 == "byte" || type2 == "char" || type2 == "int" || type2 == "long" ||
00102                    type2 == "short") {
00103                         if(warn)
00104                                 pushWarning(c, "Possible loss in precision casting '%s' to '%s'", type1, type2);
00105                         return true;
00106                 }
00107                 
00108                 // can't do it
00109                 return false;
00110         } else if(type1 == "int") {
00111                 // definite
00112                 if(type2 == "boolean" || type2 == "double" || type2 == "long" || type2 == "quad")
00113                         return true;
00114                 
00115                 // may lose precision, but still works
00116                 if(type2 == "byte" || type2 == "char" || type2 == "float" || type2 == "short") {
00117                         if(warn)
00118                                 pushWarning(c, "Possible loss in precision casting '%s' to '%s'", type1, type2);
00119                         return true;
00120                 }
00121                 
00122                 // can't do it
00123                 return false;
00124         } else if(type1 == "long") {
00125                 // definite
00126                 if(type2 == "boolean" || type2 == "quad")
00127                         return true;
00128                 
00129                 // may lose precision, but still works
00130                 if(type2 == "byte" || type2 == "char" || type2 == "float" || type2 == "short" ||
00131                    type2 == "double" || type2 == "long" || type2 == "int") {
00132                         if(warn)
00133                                 pushWarning(c, "Possible loss in precision casting '%s' to '%s'", type1, type2);
00134                         return true;
00135                 }
00136                 
00137                 // can't do it
00138                 return false;
00139         } else if(type1 == "quad") {
00140                 // definite
00141                 if(type2 == "boolean")
00142                         return true;
00143                 
00144                 // may lose precision, but still works
00145                 if(type2 == "byte" || type2 == "char" || type2 == "double" ||
00146                    type2 == "float" || type2 == "int" || type2 == "long" || type2 == "short") {
00147                         if(warn)
00148                                 pushWarning(c, "Possible loss in precision casting '%s' to '%s'", type1, type2);
00149                         return true;
00150                 }
00151                 
00152                 // can't do it
00153                 return false;
00154         } else if(type1 == "short") {
00155                 // definite
00156                 if(type2 == "boolean" || type2 == "char" || type2 == "int" || type2 == "short" ||
00157                    type2 == "double" || type2 == "float" || type2 == "long" || type2 == "quad")
00158                         return true;
00159                 
00160                 // may lose precision, but still works
00161                 if(type2 == "byte")
00162                         return true;
00163                 
00164                 // can't do it
00165                 return false;
00166         }
00167         
00168         // we can have one type fit into another as long is it is extended
00169         // bug #21: we have to look at the inheritence of the inheritence, etc
00170         int nID1, oID1, nID2, oID2;
00171         findClass(c, type1, nID1, oID1);
00172         findClass(c, type2, nID2, oID2);
00173         if(nID1 >= 0 && oID1 >= 0 && nID2 >= 0 && oID2 >= 0) {
00174                 StringList extends = split(',', c->namespaces->at(nID2).objects->at(oID2)->extends);
00175                 for(int i = 0; i < extends.length(); ++i)
00176                         if(findMavenObjectPath(c, type1) == findMavenObjectPath(c, extends[i]))
00177                                 return true;
00178         }
00179         
00180         return false;
00181 }
